revised_title: The Seed-like Fructification of Lepidocarpon: A Genus of Fossil Lycopodiaeeous Cones from the Carboniferous Formation
tldr: The author provides a full, illustrated description of the fossils in question, discussing their morphology and affinities. The seed-like organs of Lepidocarpon are considered to have close analogies with true seeds but differ too widely from the seeds of known Spermophyta to indicate any genetic connection between Lycopods and Gymnosperms or other Phanerogams.
